A 35-year old smoker presents with severe retro sternal pain which is radiating to neck and worsens after heavy meals occasionally it makes him wake up at night. Upper GI Endoscopic examination does not reveal any mass but a velvety patch in the lower esophagus. Biopsy from the lesion is likely to show

options.label: B
options.text: Malignant looking glands infiltrating the muscle

options.label: C
options.text: Benign looking glands which are Alcian blue positive

options.label: D
options.text: Viral inclusions in the epithelial cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Benign looking glands which are Alcian blue positive
